Raksha is a fictional character featured in Rudyard Kipling's Mowgli stories, 
collected in The Jungle Book and The Second Jungle Book. She is a female 
Indian wolf, member of the Seeonee pack, who while suckling her own cubs 
decides also to adopt a human "cub" that her mate Father Wolf has found 
wandering in the jungle, ... In the film, Raksha raises Mowgli as her son under the 
sanctuary of Akela...
